body:
# evdev.cr

Crystal bindings to [libevdev](https://www.freedesktop.org/wiki/Software/libevdev/).

[**API Documentation**](https://nickbclifford.github.io/evdev.cr/)

## Documentation

As these bindings are effectively just a wrapper (i.e. minimal abstraction), behavior is identical to that described in the
[libevdev docs](https://www.freedesktop.org/software/libevdev/doc/latest/index.html) unless otherwise specified.

## Installation

1. Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`:

   ```yaml
   dependencies:
     evdev:
       github: nickbclifford/evdev.cr
   ```

2. Run `shards install`

## Usage

```crystal
require "evdev"

File.open("/dev/input/event0") do |file|
  device = Evdev::Device.from_file(file)
  puts device.name
end
```

## Contributing

1. Fork it (<https://github.com/nickbclifford/evdev.cr/fork>)
2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`)
5. Create a new Pull Request

## Contributors

- [Nick Clifford](https://github.com/nickbclifford) - creator and maintainer

types.name: All
types.aliased: (Evdev::Codes::Abs | Evdev::Codes::Ff | Evdev::Codes::FfStatus | Evdev::Codes::Key | Evdev::Codes::Led | Evdev::Codes::Msc | Evdev::Codes::Rel | Evdev::Codes::Rep | Evdev::Codes::Snd | Evdev::Codes::Sw | Evdev::Codes::Syn)

types.name: Key
types.doc: Enum members cannot start with a number, so any members that otherwise would have Key prepended.
types.summary: Enum members cannot start with a number, so any members that otherwise would have Key prepended.

def.name: from_file
def.body:
if (LibEvdev.new_from_fd(file.fd, out dev)) < 0
  raise(Error.from_errno)
end
new(dev)

def.name: event_pending?
def.body:
if (val = with_dev(has_event_pending)) < 0
  raise(Error.from_errno)
else
  val == 1
end

instance_methods.name: event_value
instance_methods.doc: Gets the current value of an event, raises if the code is not supported by the device.
instance_methods.summary: Gets the current value of an event, raises if the code is not supported by the device.

def.name: event_value
def.body:
if value = event_value?(code)
  value
else
  raise(Error.new("Device does not support event #{code.type} #{code}"))
end

instance_methods.name: event_value?
instance_methods.doc: Gets the current value of an event, returns nil if the code is not supported by the device.
instance_methods.summary: Gets the current value of an event, returns nil if the code is not supported by the device.

def.name: event_value?
def.body:
if (with_dev(fetch_event_value, *pair(code), out value)) == 0
  value
else
  nil
end

def.name: next_event
def.body:
if (val = with_dev(next_event, flags, out event)) < 0
  raise(Error.from_errno)
else
  LibEvdev::ReadStatus.new(val)
end

def.name: set_event_value
def.body: try(set_event_value, "Unable to set event #{code.type} #{code} to #{value}", *pair(code), value)

def.name: set_slot_value
def.body: try(set_slot_value, "Unable to set slot #{slot} #{code} to #{value}", slot, code, value)

def.name: slot_value
def.body:
if value = slot_value?(code)
  value
else
  raise(Error.new("Device does not support slot #{slot} #{code}"))
end

def.name: slot_value?
def.body:
if (with_dev(fetch_slot_value, slot, code, out value)) == 0
  value
else
  nil
end

def.name: toggle_event_type
toggle_property

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Creates a new uinput device from a `Device` and an open file handle to `/dev/uinput`.
If `file` is `nil`, libevdev will automatically create and manage its own uinput handle.
constructors.summary: Creates a new uinput device from a Device and an open file handle to /dev/uinput.

def.name: write_event
def.body:
if (with_dev(write_event, code.type, code, value)) < 0
  raise(Error.from_errno)
end
